class Log4D;
General purpose logging class with file count and size limits and rollover.

The name implies no similarity to the workings of log4j

enum Log4DStyle;
At the moment there is only one logging style, but please feel free to roll your own.

this(char[] path, char[] prefix, Log4DStyle style = cast(Log4DStyle)0, int maxfiles = 0, int maxsize = 0);
Single constructor

Log files are named with a prefix to indicate their host application, and a timestamp to the millisecond.

Params:
char[] path Path to the directory where log files are to be kept
char[] prefix Distinguishing prefix for the log files - usually an abbreviation of the host application name.
Log4DStyle style One of possibly several styles mentioned in enum Log4DStyle - only one now.
int maxfiles Maximum number of log files to retain at any time.
int maxsize Size at which to rollover and create a new log file.

bool OK();
Sentinel to check that the logger was created OK.

synchronized void logMessage(char[] msgType, char[] msg);
The method to log messages.

Override this to create you own message formats

This version creates log entries like:
"[YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS:mmm] INFO: The message"

Params:
char[] msgType A string to label the message after the timestamp - e.g. INFO
char[] msg The text to be logged
